physical_appearance:The image shows a photograph that is in black-and-white. It is rectangular and it featurers two single-storey buildings
 with roofs
 in a rural area. There is a bicycle and several chairs situated outside the building nearer to the foreground of the image. One window is closed while the other three windows of this building are open.

sgcool_label_text:A native of Karuvakurichi village
 near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu
 S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying
 handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957
 he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai
 Govindasamy Sarangapany
 Pakkirisami Pillai
 and had friendly associations with them.

metadata.title_text: Kitchen annex of house at Coronoation Road West, late 1940s    Photograph of kitchen annex of house at Coronoation Road West, late 1940s
metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph that is in black-and-white. It is rectangular and it featurers two single-storey buildings, with roofs, in a rural area. There is a bicycle and several chairs situated outside the building nearer to the foreground of the image. One window is closed while the other three windows of this building are open.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: A native of Karuvakurichi village, near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu, S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying, handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957, he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai, Govindasamy Sarangapany, Pakkirisami Pillai, and had friendly associations with them.
